title: There needs to be a better detection system for trolls
body: To start off, no, I am not raging at someone having a bad game and refusing to type in team chat, or someone getting tilted and no longer caring. Recently, I was in a game with a draven (had a similar name to tyler1 so likely a fanboy of the “toxic” persona” who got bad at the team, so proceeded to do everything in his power to make us lose. Stealing farm from jungle, and I don’t mean just getting behind and farming to get back in the game. I mean walking around my entire jungle, taking camps and leaving 1 wolf, 1 raptor, etc. stealing farm from top and mid lane. Ulting into our fountain. Sitting in botlane, waiting for enemy to come and kill him. He admitted to trolling in ally chat, and I explain all of this in my report. I requested a human, and got the same “report successfully solved, we can’t tell you what happens blah blah blah”. I check his account today and he’s still playing this game.

replies.body: That doesn't mean he wasn't punished or this isn't a punishment on the way. Most gameplay infractions take awhile to review and punish, it is not an instant system. You reported them which is the most you can do. Just move on and good luck in your future games.

most bans when a player is flaming teammates is an automatic ban...……….. when a player goes 0/20 with mobis and no other items it is an automatic ban...……. I understand that. but an entire day, when I requested a human. all they need to do is check the chat logs and watch not even 5 minutes of gameplay to realize that draven was clearly trolling. this is especially frustrating because I have been trolled so many times, however this is only the second time I have actually submitted a ticket because of the clear obviousness of the action.
They receive an absolutely MASSIVE number of reports per day that require or request a manual review. Unfortunately I am sure that the backlog for reviewing these is more than a day.

that is a failure by this company to properly detect and punish trolls. this is straight and simple.
All a report in ticket does is to queue the game to be reviewed. That queuing process was completed, doesn't mean the review was.
